ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you have any interest exploring unfamiliar topics and daring to fix hard problems, then you should considered this course. If you enjoy introspection and reevaluating key assumptions of your professional life, take this course.
This is the best course I've taken at Yale.
This class is a good mix of theory/ readings, group work and speakers. It's engaging and there's something for everyone in the material. And I'd take anything Eric Braverman teaches in a heartbeat.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course directly relates to my continuing career in the US Army. I work in an interagency environment that requires a knack for teamwork and navigating bureaucracy. Innovations in Government provided strategies to overcoming inevitable hurdles and achieving success for the public.
It worked really well with the themes I was also exploring in other classes.
It helped me think about a lot of topics that I've encountered in my (short) professional life.
